timeline.body:
```suggestion
        return response != null ? Arrays.asList(response)  : List.of();
```

or is it necessary to alter the array afterwards?

(Also applies below).
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
return response != null ? new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(response)) : new ArrayList<>();
return response != null ? Arrays.asList(response) : List.of();

or is it necessary to alter the array afterwards?

(Also applies below).
timeline.author: J-N-K

timeline.body: This is a change from the behaviour before. Is that intended? Before the thing changed to OFFLINE in case of an encoding error.
timeline.bodyText: This is a change from the behaviour before. Is that intended? Before the thing changed to OFFLINE in case of an encoding error.
timeline.bodyHTML: This is a change from the behaviour before. Is that intended? Before the thing changed to OFFLINE in case of an encoding error.

replies.bodyText: yes, this is intended. From my point of view there is no need to put thing OFFLINE, rather return unencoded string

timeline.body: `StringUtils` should not be used in new code. In this case you can just use `state.getName().isEmpty()` since `getName()` is non-null.
timeline.bodyText: StringUtils should not be used in new code. In this case you can just use state.getName().isEmpty() since getName() is non-null.
timeline.bodyHTML: StringUtils should not be used in new code. In this case you can just use state.getName().isEmpty() since getName() is non-null.
